akn:subsection.akn:heading: Matters involving agency determinations to be made on record after agency hearing

akn:content.akn:p: (d) Matters involving agency determinations to be made on record after agency hearing The Commission shall have jurisdiction to hear and determine any other matter arising under any other function of the Secretary— except that nothing in this subsection shall require that functions under sections 6213 and 6214 1 of this title shall be within the jurisdiction of the Commission unless the Secretary assigns such a function to the Commission.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Matters assigned by Secretary after public notice and matters referred under section 7174 of this title

akn:content.akn:p: (e) Matters assigned by Secretary after public notice and matters referred under In addition to the other provisions of this section, the Commission shall have jurisdiction over any other matter which the Secretary may assign to the Commission after public notice, or which are required to be referred to the Commission pursuant to section 7174 of this title.

(f) Limitation No function described in this section which regulates the exports or imports of natural gas or electricity shall be within the jurisdiction of the Commission unless the Secretary assigns such a function to the Commission.

(g) Final agency action The decision of the Commission involving any function within its jurisdiction, other than action by it on a matter referred to it pursuant to section 7174 of this title, shall be final agency action within the meaning of section 704 of title 5 and shall not be subject to further review by the Secretary or any officer or employee of the Department.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Rules, regulations, and statements of policy

akn:content.akn:p: (h) Rules, regulations, and statements of policy The Commission is authorized to prescribe rules, regulations, and statements of policy of general applicability with respect to any function under the jurisdiction of the Commission pursuant to this section.
